replies.body: So it'll be moving from PBE to a single region beta, and, if that works well, a gradual rollout. Maybe we (in OCE) will get this feature in 2016. Mid 2016.

You are so right my friend, not even an over exaggeration, about a year from now we will get this update, on OCE.
They don't even consider OCE Anymore It has noob ammetures can't make it to worlds, even Brazil is considered more than OCE,  according to my calculations {{champion:74}}
I think it's because of our internet. I generally have 90 ping each match, but my brother streams videos so often that it always jumps up to 700, and I can never make the plays that I want to make
my ping is 21 most matches

tbh its more the point that oceania combined is still have less then 50million people now put that into people who play league and its under 50k or something meanwhile na has a few million because there population is at 300million so its ovisly going to be that were not as good
shhhhhh, everyone was happy till they realised this, dont speed up the process
So basically, noone cares about OCE thanks riot, thanks
what does ranking up do
it ranks u up .__.
Yes.
it says "rewards" but at the moment I have no clue, I see it as being proof for people who say "first time ______ so if I feed don't get angry"
One more reason to play {{champion:17}}
hell yeah!
you are the reason i have trust issues
I can't believe they use Akali as an example of one of the champions mastered... Rengar and Draven players deserve their recognition but Akali can get fked.
Correction, it's harder to play akali now since ground breaking nerfs
correction it will never be hard to play akali
I'm keen for this, then you can finally see who you really work best with and which other champs need improvement.
Now I can become a true Urgod Master!
What a great idea that has been implemented! Go RIOT!
Why would you want your enemy to know you are skilled with your champion.

Anyone using lolskill already can see your KDA and win rates with champs, including them in this way doesn't give any new information to enemy players than they could already get but it is an interesting progression system for all players.
Am i the only one who has no idea what the "S" stands for. ABCD grades seem to make sense, but i cant figure out S.
no one actually knows. Its a Japanese thing. Basically meant to mean perfect.
I always thought it was for "super". It is a word from the far regions of space, and usually precedes the word "saiyan" and a punch in the throat.
S-rank = A ranking used to describe a level that is so superlative that it cannot be described by the traditional ranking system
What is the point of Tier 1,2,3 if they don't do anything?
To make sure you don't get to tier 4 early, meaning you play their game longer.
Why not just make it harder to get from tier 1 to tier 2 and make tier 2 useful
Lmao. That's like saying "why is there bronze silver and gold ranks?" It's because not every scrub is plat.
but bronze silver and gold still give rewards
Rito is trying to find out which champs u play the most and nerf it. o.o
Now you can easily tell half of OCE only plays one champion
Yes. The Skillful ones that take great mechanical mastery: {{champion:92}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:8}}
and {{champion:84}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:105}} imo

you forgot {{champion:86}}
Oh no, this is why I hate being a completionist. :'( Soo many custom emotes to be unlocked!
Smite has been doing this... from the start im pretty sure XD
I'm not against Riot adopting it. It generally makes people want to do better for themselves, and in effect the team.
so has heroes of the storm but you get levels for your hero then a master skin.
a master skin would be AWESOME in LoL but riot probably dont like giving away free skins :D
It'll reach OCE when we get perma 3v3 TT, so... in 2017-18?

2020.

Riot's five year plan is in full swing to bring enlightenment and joy to non SR players.
